thread.title: Former coach helps keep Devils winless
thread.title_full: Former coach helps keep Devils winless - Times Union

author: timesunion.com
title: Former coach helps keep Devils winless
text:
Photo: Julio Cortez Image 1 of / 1 Caption
Close
Image 1 of 1 San Jose Sharks defenseman Brent Burns (88) scores a shootout goal against New Jersey Devils goalie Cory Schneider (35) during an NHL hockey game, Friday, Oct. 16, 2015, in Newark, N.J. The Sharks won 2-1 in a shootout. (AP Photo/Julio Cortez) ORG XMIT: NJJC109 San Jose Sharks defenseman Brent Burns (88) scores a shootout goal against New Jersey Devils goalie Cory Schneider (35) during an NHL hockey game, Friday, Oct. 16, 2015, in Newark, N.J. The Sharks won 2-1 in ... more Photo: Julio Cortez Former coach helps keep Devils winless 1 / 1 Back to Gallery Newark, N.J.
Joe Pavelski and Brent Burns scored in the shootout and the San Jose Sharks rode another big effort by goaltender Martin Jones in posting a 2-1 victory over the winless New Jersey Devils on Friday night.
Jones stopped 31 shots and came within 3:38 of posting his third straight shutout as the Sharks posted their fourth straight win under former New Jersey coach Pete DeBoer . They also kept the Devils winless at 0-3-1 under new coach John Hynes .
DeBoer, who was fired by the Devils last season, is now 4-0 with San Jose.
Patrick Marleau scored for the Sharks in the opening minute and the goal stood until Adam Henrique tied the game on a power play with 3:38 to play in regulation.
Henrique scored for New Jersey on its first shootout attempt but Jacob Josefson was stopped on the second and Mike Cammalleri missed the net on the third.
Hurricanes 5, Red Wings 3: Jordan Staal and Kris Versteeg each had a goal and two assists and Carolina handed Detroit its first loss of the season. Brock McGinn added a goal and an assist in his NHL debut. Cam Ward only needed to make 17 saves to help Carolina to its first win. Jimmy Howard faced 36 shots for Detroit (3-1).
Maple Leafs 6, Blue Jackets 3: Leo Komarov scored two late goals and Toronto gave Mike Babcock his first victory as coach of the Maple Leafs. Joffrey Lupul had a goal and an assist. Daniel Winnik added three assists, Morgan Rielly had two, and James Reimer finished with 24 saves. Scott Hartnell had a goal and an assist to reach 600 career points for Columbus. The Blue Jackets are 0-5, extending the worst start in franchise history. Sergei Bobrovsky made 28 saves. Columbus has allowed 26 goals.
Jets 3, Flames 1: Bryan Little and Blake Wheeler had a goal and an assist each, and Ondrej Pavelec had 19 saves. Mikael Backlund scored for Calgary.
Notes: Sharks center Logan Couture will likely miss four to six weeks after breaking a leg during practice Thursday. ... Lightning defenseman Nikita Nesterov was suspended for two games without pay for Thursday's boarding of Stars forward Curtis McKenzie , who was taken to a hospital.
